profileText: A Representative from North Carolina; born in Newport, R.I., November 20, 1819; completed preparatory studies; was graduated from the medical department of the University of Pennsylvania at Philadelphia in 1838 and began practice in Indiantown, Camden County, N.C.; elected as a Democrat to the Thirty-third Congress (March 4, 1853-March 3, 1855); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Thirty-fourth Congress; elected to the Thirty-fifth Congress (March 4, 1857-March 3, 1859); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Thirty-sixth Congress; served as a colonel in the Confederate Army during the Civil War and was killed near New Bern, N.C., November 1, 1864; interment in the cemetery at Shawboro, Currituck County, N.C.

researchRecord.name: 1854, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Henry Marchmore Shaw to President Pierce written on December 12, 1854. In the letter, Henry Marchmore Shaw writes concerning a successor to Judge Potter. The letter is also signed by Thomas Ruffin and Thomas Lanier Clingman.

recordLocation.name: Department of Literary and Historical Manuscripts
